answers.answer: Rita,First of all, since it is on the left side, you may want to confirm your heart is ok.  Other than that, it sounds as if you may have a pinched nerve somewhere maybe in your neck area.  That can make your tingling feeling and race horses could definitely cause the pinching.  After you confirm your heart is ok, I would suggest a visit to the chiropractor or doctor for a muscle relaxer to free it.Good luck to you!Jenny

I agree with gabbygirl. Since it is on the left side, I would have your heart checked, but, other than that, I suspect it is a pinched nerve and a good chriopractor can help that in no time. I have that same problem, but, in both hands and fingers, and my chiropractor really helps, I also have TOS (thoracic outlet syndrome) and this really causes the tingling, etc. TOS is caused by very tight shoulder blade muscles and also neck muscles and they impinge the flow of blood to the hand and fingers and even the head and face.
You could have a trapped nerve or muscle damage,try taking an anti imflamortry tablet to ease the pain.

This sounds like peripheral neuropathy.  You shouldn't ignore it.  Some kinds of neuropathy are caused by diabetes, too.  Not all diabetics are overweight either.  Usually they are, but not always.  There are other serious causes of this neuropathy, too, so you definitely need to see your doctor.  Have you had your risk factors for stroke, like BP and cholesterol checked lately?  Please see your doctor for this and don't ignore it.
